intro: Calopyxis alata, commonly known as the winged calopyxis, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive winged stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Calopyxis alata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
